title: Morning Sunlight Viewing
description: View sunlight outside within 30-60 minutes of waking for 10-30 minutes. This halts melatonin production and triggers a healthy cortisol spike early in the day, setting a timer for melatonin release (and deep sleep) ~14 hours later.

title: Core Temperature Drop
description: Keep your bedroom cool (65-67°F or 18-19.4°C). To fall and stay deeply asleep, your core body temperature must drop by 1-3°F. You can accelerate this by taking a warm shower 1-2 hours before bed (causing evaporative cooling).

title: Magnesium L-Threonate or Bisglycinate
description: Take 145mg Magnesium L-Threonate or 200mg Magnesium Bisglycinate 3-4 hours before sleep. It crosses the blood-brain barrier efficiently, promoting GABAergic signaling to transition the brain into deep sleep.

title: Consistent Sleep Schedule
description: Go to bed and wake up at exactly the same time everyday (±30 minutes), even on weekends. Consistency anchors your circadian rhythm, which is mathematically proven to increase overall REM sleep consolidation.

title: Evening Alcohol & Fluid Fast
description: Stop all alcohol consumption in the evening, as it acts as a REM-suppressant. Furthermore, limit all general fluids 2 hours before bed to prevent waking up in the middle of the night (which shatters REM architecture).

title: Resonance Frequency Breathing
description: Practice slow-paced diaphragmatic breathing for 5-6 minutes daily (e.g., inhale for 4s, exhale for 6s, around 6 breaths per minute). This mechanically stimulates the vagus nerve via respiratory sinus arrhythmia, drastically boosting Heart Rate Variability (HRV).

title: NSDR (Non-Sleep Deep Rest)
description: A 10-30 minute guided Yoga Nidra protocol. Replaces lost sleep and rapidly shifts the autonomic nervous system from sympathetic to parasympathetic dominance. Extremely effective for managing sleep anxiety if you wake up at 3 AM.

title: Physiological Sighs
description: Two rapid inhales through the nose followed by a long, extended exhale through the mouth. Performing this 2-3 times offloads maximum CO2, creating an immediate, real-time spike in HRV and reducing acute stress.

title: Nature Exposure & Zone 2 Cardio
description: Spend time outdoors or perform steady-state Zone 2 cardiovascular exercise (where you can hold a conversation) 3 hours after waking. This strengthens the cardiovascular adaptations needed to inherently support a higher baseline HRV.
